author: norswap
content:
In https://dankradfeist.de/ethereum/2021/02/14/why-stateless.html

> Because if we go all the way, the executable Eth1 blocks can become a shard. Note that in the executable beacon chain proposal, all validators have to run the full Eth1 execution all the time (or they risk signing invalid blocks).

I'm don't get this. After the merge, why should validators on other shards need to know about the state of the Eth1 shard (or risk signing invalid blocks)? Shouldn't the state of the beacon chain be enough?

author: potuz
content: There are no validators on other shards that are not validating the beacon chain. And for the latter you need the ETH 1 state
